messages.message:
Hi team, I'm working on the Rocket Mortgage project and was previously on the Uber POV. On both project, I've always had to run a new flow to do a Golden comparison. I'm guessing this was originally designed with the thought that new results or changes to the refiner / validation rules would occur for someone to want to do another comparison with the Goldens. However, I find myself often fixing the Goldens or want to quickly compare the Goldens to a completed flow run.

Considering for a run with only 30 documents, it takes an average of 10 minutes to run through a flow and do the Golden comparison. This would save me hours of time per project that I would usually need to wait for the results from the Goldens.

Is this something that's on the Product / Engineering team's radar?

cc: @Nithin @Piyush @Ganan Prabaharan @Charles

Actually, it looks like they already made a consideration for this, but I think it only works when editing Goldens/GT within the Flow Editor UI, instead of exporting the .xlsx, fixing in a spreadsheet, & reimporting.

In the screenshot below, notice how the 2nd record from the bottom has an orange value in the Ground Truth column, this is orange because I just edited it.  Then once at least 1 value has been edited, the `Recompute` button shows up between _Compare_ and _Export_.  Then when I hit that, it'll only take a fraction of the total flow time to give me updated metrics.

I often find myself editing the Goldens offline, which tends to be a lot faster than individually editing each value. The above solution only works if you're making edits to the Golden that you are working on and if you have already run the Golden and gotten the performance already.

Imagine you just created the Goldens and you want to run it again the run that you created the Goldens from. You'd need to run the same flow again.

@eddie.hou
Let us track this through PFR.Instructions here (https://instabase.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/PROD/pages/1725464577/Product+Feedback+Process).

What we need is probably a golden data editor view so it's easier to modify it on the platform. We can also allow just comparing results to goldens instead of running the flow to do so. 

cc: @Arjun this could be something we look to enable in solution builder

@Eric Han @Nithin Using the current template to create PFR, it's hard to emphasize the importance and impact of this change as it's not something that's coming from the customer directly. Of course, the improvement will lead to better customer experience via faster delivery times on solutions and POVs and their development experience but this isn't being driven by the customer themselves.
It'll be helpful to have the pfr just for tracking purposes. We may not address all of it in 23.04 but we will still have a record of it

https://instabase.atlassian.net/jira/polaris/projects/PFR/ideas/view/727954?selectedIssue=PFR-1017&issueViewSection=comments

I've created it but it's a skeleton without the customer information. :skull:
